This first Numberblocks® puzzle helps little ones learn basic addition and subtraction skills with their friends the Numberblocks. There are 10 addition and 10 subtraction puzzles featuring Zero to Ten. Each Numberblocks addition puzzle and Numberblocks subtraction puzzle has 2 pieces. Match the simple maths question to the correct answer piece to complete the puzzle. Each clever puzzle fits together in a unique way so there’s only one right answer. changed_products.title: Montessori My First Puzzle The Farm

description:
Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations!
 Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits.

  
 * Introductory mechanical engineering kit for ages three and up 
 * Build six awesome models 
 * Large plastic tools are perfect for small hands and safe to use 
 * Building pieces are compatible with components from other Kids First early engineering kits 
 * Full-color, eight-page manual includes clear and detailed step-by-step assembly instructions 
 * Unique and engaging way to introduce simple engineering concepts to young children 
 * Develops fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills 
 * Endless possibilities for open-ended creative play 
 * Age 3+

title: Cute Pets Plaster Casting Kit - Fun Arts & Crafts for Kids Ages 5+, Create Adorable Fridge Magnets & Badges
4M Mould & Paint Cute Pets
description: 4M Mould & Paint Cute Pets Fridge Magnets and Badges Unleash your inner artist and bring home a menagerie of adorable companions with the 4M Mould & Paint Cute Pets kit, a super fun hands-on activity designed to spark creativity in little ones aged 5 and up. This exciting arts and crafts set from BigJigs Toys provides everything you need for a delightful crafting adventure, allowing you to mould and paint your very own collection of charming pets. Imagine the joy of creating your own unique fridge magnets or turning your handcrafted critters into fun badges to adorn backpacks or jackets. Inside this treasure trove of crafting fun, you’ll discover a versatile mould featuring six different irresistible pet designs, just waiting for your imaginative touch. You'll also find a generous supply of plaster powder, enough to bring 12 delightful creatures to life, ensuring plenty of sculpting and decorating fun for everyone. To transform your creations into cherished keepsakes, the kit conveniently includes magnetic strips so they can proudly display your artwork on any metallic surface. Plus, with a set of handy brooch pins, your pets can become wearable art, ready to accompany you on all your daily adventures. The kit comes complete with a vibrant paint strip boasting six beautiful colours, perfect for adding personality and flair to each unique pet, along with a specially sized paintbrush designed for little hands to wield with precision. changed_products.title: My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy

title: My First Coding and Robotics
My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy
description:
My First Coding and Robotics is a brilliant starter kit to teach coding principles with a cute little robot. You don’t need a tablet, smartphone, or computer to program this robot; programs are created by simply laying down a sequence of physical code cards.

 As the robot drives over the code cards, an Optical identifier sensor or optical scanner on the bottom of the robot, reads the code cards one by one and loads the program. Next, place the robot on a grid made of map cards, and the robot runs the program. You can program the robot to move in different directions, activate its output gear, light up its LED, play sounds, and respond to different function cards. The integrated output gear makes it possible to build simple robotic creations with arms or other moving parts that respond according to the program’s instructions.

 This robot kit also teaches physical engineering and problem solving skills through a series of building and coding lessons. The 30 lessons are aligned with standards for computer science education developed by the Computer Science Teachers Association (CSTA) and the International Society for Technology (ISTE) Education, as well as courses from Code.org.

 The lessons or activities progress in complexity through the illustrated manual, allowing the kit to be appropriate for a child as young as four years with help from an adult and as old as eight years. The lessons cover these six key areas in coding: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables.

 In addition to Sammy (the robot), there are five other stories, each with a series of model-building and coding challenges and lessons related to it: a mouse moves through a maze to find cheese; a penguin wanders around a zoo; a soccer player moves a ball into the goal; a fire truck puts out a fire; and a factory robot performs tasks in a factory scene. A full-colour illustrated manual guides (https://www.thamesandkosmos.com/manuals/full/567012_Kids-First-Coding&Robotics-Manual.pdf) users through the coding lessons and the assembly of the different models.

 Requires 3 AA batteries, supplied separately.

 Ages 4 to 8 years.

My First Coding and Robotics Kit: A Fun Journey into Programming and Engineering! Get ready for an exciting adventure into the world of coding and robotics with the My First Coding and Robotics Kit! This fantastic set is designed to introduce young minds, ages 4 to 8, to the fundamentals of programming in a super engaging and hands-on way. Forget about needing screens or complex devices; this kit uses clever physical code cards that your adorable robot pal, Sammy, reads with its special optical identifier sensor on its underside. Simply lay out a sequence of these code cards, and watch as Sammy understands its mission! Once programmed, place Sammy on a grid made of map cards, and get ready to see your creations come to life! Sammy can be programmed to zoom in different directions, activate its integrated output gear for fun moving parts like arms, flash its colorful LED lights, and even play cheerful sounds. The possibilities are endless as your child learns to think like a programmer and an engineer. The built-in output gear is a game-changer, allowing kids to build simple robotic creations that respond to their coded commands, fostering creativity and a sense of accomplishment. This kit is more than just play; it's a brilliant introduction to physical engineering and essential problem-solving skills through a series of progressively challenging building and coding lessons. These 30 illustrated lessons are expertly crafted and aligned with important computer science education standards from organizations like CSTA and ISTE, and even courses from Code.org, ensuring a valuable learning experience. The full-color illustrated manual, which can be accessed online for convenience, provides step-by-step guidance for both coding lessons and model assembly, making it perfect for adult-child collaboration or independent exploration for older kids. The lessons cleverly cover six key coding areas: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables, all presented in a way that feels like fun and discovery. Sammy isn't the only star; the kit includes five other engaging stories with related model-building and coding challenges. Imagine a mouse navigating a maze to find cheese, a penguin exploring a zoo, a soccer player scoring a goal, a fire truck bravely putting out a blaze, or a factory robot efficiently completing its tasks. Each scenario provides a unique context for applying learned coding concepts. To power Sammy's adventures, you'll need 3 AA batteries, which are conveniently supplied separately. This kit truly makes learning about technology an enjoyable and accessible experience for the whole family.

Truckloads of puzzle fun! Three happy trucks are on the way to their next destination. They need to pick up a load of packages, but will the haul fit? Can you help them stack everything properly? Toddlers initially play with the trucks, loading them up and driving them round like a toy car. Kids who are a bit older can play the game, working through the challenges that gradually get more and more difficult. Age:   3+ Challenges:   48

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. description: 4M Mould & Paint Cute Pets Fridge Magnets and Badges Unleash your inner artist and bring home a menagerie of adorable companions with the 4M Mould & Paint Cute Pets kit, a super fun hands-on activity designed to spark creativity in little ones aged 5 and up. This exciting arts and crafts set from BigJigs Toys provides everything you need for a delightful crafting adventure, allowing you to mould and paint your very own collection of charming pets. Imagine the joy of creating your own unique fridge magnets or turning your handcrafted critters into fun badges to adorn backpacks or jackets. Inside this treasure trove of crafting fun, you’ll discover a versatile mould featuring six different irresistible pet designs, just waiting for your imaginative touch. You'll also find a generous supply of plaster powder, enough to bring 12 delightful creatures to life, ensuring plenty of sculpting and decorating fun for everyone. To transform your creations into cherished keepsakes, the kit conveniently includes magnetic strips so they can proudly display your artwork on any metallic surface. Plus, with a set of handy brooch pins, your pets can become wearable art, ready to accompany you on all your daily adventures. The kit comes complete with a vibrant paint strip boasting six beautiful colours, perfect for adding personality and flair to each unique pet, along with a specially sized paintbrush designed for little hands to wield with precision. Easy-to-follow detailed instructions guide you through every step of the moulding and painting process, making this a wonderfully engaging and educational activity that fosters fine motor skills and imaginative play. This kit isn't just about making pretty things; it's about the experience of bringing something unique into the world, from the initial moulding to the final flourish of paint. Get ready for hours of engaging entertainment as you transform simple plaster into a captivating collection of cute pets, each one a testament to your child's growing artistic talents. It's a fantastic way to encourage artistic expression and develop a sense of accomplishment with every finished piece, making it a truly rewarding craft experience for the whole family.

A great arts and crafts kit from 4M. This kit contains everything you need to create little masterpieces! Mould and paint your own cute pets and turn them into fridge magnets or badges. The kits includes a mould with six different designs, enough plaster powder to make 12 pieces, magnets, brooch pins, a paint strip of 6 colours, a paint brush and detailed instructions.Suggested Age: 5+

description_changes.title: My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy

title: My First Coding and Robotics
My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy
description:
My First Coding and Robotics is a brilliant starter kit to teach coding principles with a cute little robot. You don’t need a tablet, smartphone, or computer to program this robot; programs are created by simply laying down a sequence of physical code cards.

 As the robot drives over the code cards, an Optical identifier sensor or optical scanner on the bottom of the robot, reads the code cards one by one and loads the program. Next, place the robot on a grid made of map cards, and the robot runs the program. You can program the robot to move in different directions, activate its output gear, light up its LED, play sounds, and respond to different function cards. The integrated output gear makes it possible to build simple robotic creations with arms or other moving parts that respond according to the program’s instructions.

 This robot kit also teaches physical engineering and problem solving skills through a series of building and coding lessons. The 30 lessons are aligned with standards for computer science education developed by the Computer Science Teachers Association (CSTA) and the International Society for Technology (ISTE) Education, as well as courses from Code.org.

 The lessons or activities progress in complexity through the illustrated manual, allowing the kit to be appropriate for a child as young as four years with help from an adult and as old as eight years. The lessons cover these six key areas in coding: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables.

 In addition to Sammy (the robot), there are five other stories, each with a series of model-building and coding challenges and lessons related to it: a mouse moves through a maze to find cheese; a penguin wanders around a zoo; a soccer player moves a ball into the goal; a fire truck puts out a fire; and a factory robot performs tasks in a factory scene. A full-colour illustrated manual guides (https://www.thamesandkosmos.com/manuals/full/567012_Kids-First-Coding&Robotics-Manual.pdf) users through the coding lessons and the assembly of the different models.

 Requires 3 AA batteries, supplied separately.

 Ages 4 to 8 years.

My First Coding and Robotics Kit: A Fun Journey into Programming and Engineering! Get ready for an exciting adventure into the world of coding and robotics with the My First Coding and Robotics Kit! This fantastic set is designed to introduce young minds, ages 4 to 8, to the fundamentals of programming in a super engaging and hands-on way. Forget about needing screens or complex devices; this kit uses clever physical code cards that your adorable robot pal, Sammy, reads with its special optical identifier sensor on its underside. Simply lay out a sequence of these code cards, and watch as Sammy understands its mission! Once programmed, place Sammy on a grid made of map cards, and get ready to see your creations come to life! Sammy can be programmed to zoom in different directions, activate its integrated output gear for fun moving parts like arms, flash its colorful LED lights, and even play cheerful sounds. The possibilities are endless as your child learns to think like a programmer and an engineer. The built-in output gear is a game-changer, allowing kids to build simple robotic creations that respond to their coded commands, fostering creativity and a sense of accomplishment. This kit is more than just play; it's a brilliant introduction to physical engineering and essential problem-solving skills through a series of progressively challenging building and coding lessons. These 30 illustrated lessons are expertly crafted and aligned with important computer science education standards from organizations like CSTA and ISTE, and even courses from Code.org, ensuring a valuable learning experience. The full-color illustrated manual, which can be accessed online for convenience, provides step-by-step guidance for both coding lessons and model assembly, making it perfect for adult-child collaboration or independent exploration for older kids. The lessons cleverly cover six key coding areas: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables, all presented in a way that feels like fun and discovery. Sammy isn't the only star; the kit includes five other engaging stories with related model-building and coding challenges. Imagine a mouse navigating a maze to find cheese, a penguin exploring a zoo, a soccer player scoring a goal, a fire truck bravely putting out a blaze, or a factory robot efficiently completing its tasks. Each scenario provides a unique context for applying learned coding concepts. To power Sammy's adventures, you'll need 3 AA batteries, which are conveniently supplied separately. This kit truly makes learning about technology an enjoyable and accessible experience for the whole family.

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations!
 Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits.

item_group_changes.title: Numberblocks Adding and Subtracting Puzzle Set

description:
This first Numberblocks® puzzle helps little ones learn basic addition and subtraction skills with their friends the Numberblocks. There are 10 addition and 10 subtraction puzzles featuring Zero to Ten. Each Numberblocks addition puzzle and Numberblocks subtraction puzzle has 2 pieces. Match the simple maths question to the correct answer piece to complete the puzzle. Each clever puzzle fits together in a unique way so there’s only one right answer. This gives children a sense of achievement as they figure out the answers themselves.

 With this Numberblocks® jigsaw puzzle, children learn what happens when they add or subtract one.

  
 * There are 10 addition puzzles and 10 subtraction puzzles featuring Numberblocks Zero to Ten.

 * Includes 20 x 2-piece puzzles. 
 * Completed puzzles measure 15cm L x 10cm W.  Age 3+

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations!
 Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits.

 * Build six awesome models 
 * Large plastic tools are perfect for small hands and safe to use 
 * Building pieces are compatible with components from other Kids First early engineering kits

 * Unique and engaging way to introduce simple engineering concepts to young children 
 * Develops fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills 
 * Endless possibilities for open-ended creative play

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations!
 Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits.

This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations! Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits. Introductory mechanical engineering kit for ages three and up Build six awesome models Large plastic tools are perfect for small hands and safe to use Building pieces are compatible with components from other Kids First early engineering kits Full-color, eight-page manual includes clear and detailed step-by-step assembly instructions Unique and engaging way to introduce simple engineering concepts to young children Develops fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills Endless possibilities for open-ended creative play Age 3+

Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work.

 This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations!
 Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits.

 * Unique and engaging way to introduce simple engineering concepts to young children 
 * Develops fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills 
 * Endless possibilities for open-ended creative play 
 * Age 3+

description: Can you identify an unknown liquid or powder? What secrets become visible under a UV light? How do you analyse fingerprints, soil, ink, and handwriting samples? Assume the role of a forensic scientist to find out! Perform experiments on evidence in this large laboratory station using chemical and physical techniques. Analyse solids and liquids, make a fluorescent solution, inspect invisible ink, lift fingerprints, look for counterfeit notes, and examine ink using chromatography. The experiments are accompanied by exciting stories of make-believe mysteries and crimes to solve.
